title: DYING_S0UL
author: DYING_S0UL
content: I came across a weird glitch. Can anybody explain what it is? Have any of you guys faced it before?So whenever there is a network issue, slow internet connection or slow loading speed, I see something like shown in the photo below. Technically nothing as that user (1700337231) existed on my thread before. And after the thread loads property, the user vanishes. You only see a glimpse of it, when the page is still loading. It will only show, if you have a very slow connection. I have noticed this many times, I don't know if I'm the only one.Username, post count, post content everything is shown as 1700337231. And the rank is hero member. Â I don't know if it's the right board to post this. Since it's related to the forum I'm posting it here.

comments.author: Orpichukwu
comments.body: I have not experienced any of such before that looks like this, but I have experienced a situation where, either due to a network issue or maybe it might be from the forum, I notice a different name attached to a member's display name under a comment section, and most times it appears that my name under a comment seems to look different from what it actually is.Â I have captured such a moment twice before, but I always taught it was just my imagination, but this post just made me think it's possible that such an issue exists due to a network issue that could appear differently depending on location or viewer.

I have been active on bitcointalk using mobile device only (entire life). If you ever logged in to bitcointalk on a mobile, you'll know how hard it is to navigate to boards to boards, threads to threads. To post, comment, reply or to see the content, you'll have to zoom in and zoom out again and again. It can become a headache for those who uses it on mobile. That's the reason I have been using it on mobile.There are two bugs though. One that I mentioned in this thread and the other one is related to PM. comments.body:
Quote from: DYING_S0UL on November 19, 2023, 08:10:12 AMYes, the addon was outdated. That's what causing the glitch, probably. It won't show without the extension enabled. I have tested several time. It only appears when the extensions are on. And only for one or two seconds.For the sake of testing and investigation, I had to add this extension and test it myself, and I was able to reproduce it First of all, yes, there's a post with a hero rank with this weird big number text, but it's hidden. You can still inspect the element and check the second post on the page with the class name "dummyPost."This class with the display property: none means it will disappear as soon as the page is loaded.This has nothing to do with slow speed or connection issues; it will always appear and disappear as soon as the page is loaded (if this extension is enabled, otherwise will be hidden by default).Now, the question is, where is it coming from?No, it's not the extension that is adding this weird post; actually, this extension is doing a favor by showing and then hiding it after the page is loaded.It's theymos... I mean, maybe, but yes, this dummy post exists on almost every page (check for yourself, inspect the tags around the ad)... not only one but three times... irrespective of if you are using the extension of not.Only theymos can answer this, but I think it has something to do with the "ad", this bitcointalk ad that appears on every page after the first posts. Because I see there's a pattern, although the number will change as the ad changes, but the ID of this ad has something to do with these posts and this number.Also, sometimes this post appears once, sometimes twice, or maybe three or four times in a row. It can be above the ad, or sometimes it's around the ad.This is the code for the one of the posts if you can't inspect:Code: Â Â Â Â
